Pseudo-random number generator using Mersenne Twister.

pseudorandom

namespace pseudorandom
Summary
Variables
MT_BaseA base struct for the Mersenne Twister class.

Variables

MT_Base

template<typename T> struct MT_Base {}

A base struct for the Mersenne Twister class.  It then specializes for T == uint.

MT_Base

template<> struct MT_Base<uint>

A Mersenne Twister (MT19937) implementation.  You first need to seed a number and then you can get the values.

Types
MTExpands as MT_Base< <uint> >.

Functions

MT_Base

MT_Base(): p_index(0)

Empty constructor.  You need to call seed separately after creating the instance.

MT_Base

MT_Base(uint s): p_index(0)

Given an argument, it initializes the instance and also calls seed with the given argument.

seed

void seed(uint s)

Initializes a random number generator using seed.  Note that this is not a true random number generator, pseudo-random numbers are generated so you have to select seed to be random enough (for example, time(0) after inclusion of time.h).

You have to call this before calling get.

pseudorandom::mt gen;
gen.seed(time(0));
printf("Random integer: %i\n", gen.get(100));

Note that there is no need to call this if you pass the seed already via constructor.

get

uint get()

Generates a 32 bit unsigned integer within the range.  Note that you need to seed a value before calling this.

get

template<typename U> U get(U range)

Generates a random number within the given range.  It’s a template in order to support all integral types.

get

float get(float range)

Generates a floating point random number within the given range.
